alert.note: Alert for Caguas (Puerto Rico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 08 at 10:25PM ADT by NWS San Juan
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 PM AST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Puerto Rico, including the following counties, Caguas, Cayey, San Lorenzo and Yabucoa. * WHEN...Until 1130 PM AST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 925 PM AST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms which continue to redevelop and move inland. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding and excessive runoff along rivers and small streams. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... San Lorenzo, Caguas, Cayey, Yabucoa, Playita, Bairoa, Martorell, Jagual, G. L. Garcia, Rosa Sanchez, Parcelas Nuevas, Comunas, Candelero Arriba and El Negro. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
